thread.title: Truck slams into Mardi Gras crowd in New Orleans
thread.title_full: Truck slams into Mardi Gras crowd in New Orleans

title: Truck slams into Mardi Gras crowd in New Orleans
text:
Truck slams into Mardi Gras crowd in New Orleans Last updated 15:34, February 26 2017 
Emergency services working at the scene of the incident. 
A truck has ploughed into a crowd watching a Mardi Gras parade in the US city of New Orleans. 
The Times-Picayune reported the crash happened on Saturday about 6.45pm, local time. 
The driver was drunk and up to 21 people have sustained injuries, New Orleans Mayor Mitch Landrieu said. 
New Orleans Police Department spokeswoman Ambria Washington said "initial reports show so far that about a dozen people are in critical condition". 
She said that number could increase as the investigation continued. #BREAKING : A driver just plowed into a large crowd of people at a #NewOrleans parade, at least 12 critically injured pic.twitter.com/WBd29vArrn — Lucid Hurricane™✘ (@Lucid4Trump) February 26, 2017 
One woman at the scene told The New Orleans Advocate that a silver truck whisked by her just feet away as she was walking through the intersection. 
Carrie Kinsella said, "I felt a rush it was so fast.'' 
Twenty-year-old Kourtney McKinnis told the Advocate that the driver of the truck seemed almost unaware of what he had just done. 
"He was just kind of out of it,'' she said. 
The Krewe of Endymion is the largest of 80 parades held during the New Orleans Mardi Gras. - AP
